attributes.action: Parliament to amend the law, requiring all councils to provide textile recycling
attributes.background:
Textile recycling should be introduced as mandatory into every single home in the U.K. 
There should also be a module introduced into schools on the importance of recycling & social responsibility. Communicating the textile recycling message to both homedwellers and dependants educated in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details:
The U.K clothing sector is responsible for more than 3m tonnes of co2 emissions.
consuming 2.16m tonnes of clothing and textiles/year, spending approx £38.4bn on clothing alone.

Households in the uk send more than 18.8m tonnes of rubbish (1.4m textiles) to landfill every year-2m tonnes more than EU counterparts.

U.K landfill rates are growing faster each year, emitting methane gas and accelerating climate change.

Anyone serious about tackling global warming should support efforts to recycle.

attributes.action: Make all injunctions free for those who are victims of domestic violence.
attributes.background:
My mum had been a victim of domestic violence for 20 years. A painful journey it had been. After finding the courage to leave she looked into implementing an injunction which was charged at £130 for each year. 
Victims are being left with an impossible choice save themselves or pay for the letter.
attributes.additional_details:
Injunction - An injunction is an equitable remedy in the form of a court order that compels a party to do or refrain from specific acts. A party that fails to comply with an injunction faces criminal or civil penalties, including possible monetary sanctions and even imprisonment. They can also be charged with contempt of court 

Wikipedia (2016) 'Injunction' available from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Injunction

attributes.action: To invest money in local government so they can support homeless shelters.
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students from Greenwood Academy in Birmingham studying GCSE Citizenship. For a campaign we feel in our local area that there is not enough support given to aid local government in building more homeless shelters and provide assistance to those who need it.

attributes.action: Allow hospital A&E to refer people to minor injuries units if not an emergancy
attributes.background: Recently several minor injuries units in my local area were closed to staff A&E for patients that likely did not have life threatening injuries. Allow A&E departments to refuse treatment for non-emergency patients so they can focus more on saving the lives of those that need them.

attributes.action: Delay plans for harsh voter ID trials until it passes a public consultation
attributes.background: In wake of the recent tower hamlets scandal, the government is trialling plans for photo voter ID laws, which would undermine democracy and disenfranchise millions of voters
attributes.additional_details: This sets a very dangerous precedent, with the possibility that many people who do not own or are unable to get a passport or driving license are not able to exercise their democratic rights, voter registration laws have already been tightened and this signals a worrying first step toward an american style system wherein voter ID laws are passed simply to prevent certain demographics from voting, these plans need at least a public consultation or some sort of free photo ID to be provided

attributes.action: Abolish old & outdated leasehold law for all leasehold flats. Make them freehold
attributes.background: Crooked & unregulated freeholders hold leaseholders to ransom with high fees. When we buy a flat, we should also own a section of the outside part of the building and parts of the communal area. Responsibility should lie with the flat owner, not the freeholder. Commonhold law may be required here.
attributes.additional_details: The freeholder of the building should be forced to sell part of their freehold (for a cheap price) at the start and then eventually force them to give up the freehold. Leaseholders in UK are being conned and ripped off by unregulated freeholders.

attributes.action: Make the law clear that any child who assists in for profit work is employed
attributes.background: Thousands of children, many of them younger than 13 in the UK, are working in commercial research, testing, marketing and consultancy. See http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/4308213/Thousands-of-children-being-paid-to-market-products-to-schoolmates.html
attributes.additional_details: The Children and Young Persons Act 1933 prohibits children younger than 13 being used to assist in for-profit work such as that described above. However, problems with enforcing this law have caused many to turn a blind eye to this. The result is many children are being exploited –have no workers’ rights, are deprived of pay and can end up doing work such as for-profit clinical testing that is unsafe for them, and so the law needs to be made clearer to ensure this does not happen.

attributes.action: Make compulsory the labeling of Eggs from Caged Hens on all food products.
attributes.background: Many consumers are grateful for the opportunity to choose between purchasing free range eggs or those from caged hens. It is troubling, however, that most food products which contain egg don't specify if the eggs used are from Caged hens. This prevents consumers making an informed, ethical choice.

attributes.action: Make a law against Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases.
attributes.background: Daily Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases are taking place. More animals are dying because of this. Animals can mistake litter for its' food when it eats this litter, it clogs up its guts - eventually killing it. With this, more species of animals are dying. Plus, it pollutes our environment.
attributes.additional_details: Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases usually take place, because of the start of a new life, or the end of a life. Instead of polluting our wildlife and environment, plant a tree. It is much cheaper, and will last a lot longer! A little plaque can be placed in front of it, to dedicate the memory of somebody, or a time/event. It is a lot cheaper, efficient and friendly (both socially and environmentally).

attributes.action: Pubs closed from 27th to 30th Dec for service staff to have a Christmas break
attributes.background: Worked in hospitality all my life, never had time to be with family over Xmas, why should we not have a few days off.

attributes.action: Remove the law that states you must stay in education until you are 18.
attributes.background: In England, you must stay in some form of education until you are 18 years old. I believe this is wrong, as it limits the choice of young people. If this law was removed, everyone would have the ability to do what they want to do after they leave school.
attributes.additional_details: As a college student myself, I understand how many people who are 16 or 17 years old feel. I believe at this age we lack rights. We don't have the right to vote, and we don't have the right to make a choice on our own futures. I feel for many, attending college isn't the right choice, and unless we are able to secure an Apprenticeship, there is no way for us to leave. Personally I find remaining at college difficult, as I would like to seek full time employment, but that choice isn't available.

attributes.action: Hold A Referendum on whether to accept Freedom of Movement post Brexit.
attributes.background: The public voted to leave the EU. But they did this for a number of reasons, and it should not be assumed this was a direct rejection to the freedom of movement. Negotiations should not be based on the assumption that the UK public disagree with the four key principles, and a vote should be held.
attributes.additional_details:
The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) itself concluded that “The vast majority of people who voted to leave the European Union did so because they believe it is best for Britain and not because they are intolerant of others.” 
The government should acknowledge the identification of this fact, and the public disapproval of hate crime and xenophobia since the vote, and as such offer the opportunity for the freedom of movement to be decided on.

attributes.action: Make inappropriate/unwanted sexual pictures fall under the indecent exposure law
attributes.background:
Most women are subjected to unwanted sexual/inappropriate pictures from men usually of their penis on most social networking sites or phone apps
I feel this should fall under the indecent exposure laws

attributes.action: All PMs must state that their duty is to enact the will of the people, not God.
attributes.background: All incoming PMs should be required to publicly confirm that their primary duty is to the electorate and to reaffirm their commitment to their election manifesto.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is not an attack on the right of acting MPs to hold personal religious beliefs. Rather, it is intended to remind our leaders that, in their public capacity, they are ultimately answerable to the electorate and that the manifesto commitments they've made to voters supersede the demands of their personal faith.

attributes.action: Enforce child protection regulations on all businesses and organisations.
attributes.background: In light of the recent exposure of sexual abuse of children in football there needs to be a way. Child protection appears as a haphazard control with many organisations failing to offer the most basic protection
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be enforceable rules
All adults must have a DBS
All companies and organisations should be registered with an official body, e.g. Ofsted. All credentials must nbe verified especially when used in advertising and websites. Child referees must be registered with the local authority ( the FA refuse to accept responsibility for children who work as referees) The current position of stating if the parents allow it must be revoked as parents expect official bodies to make competent decisions on their behalf.

attributes.action: Ban all-metal manhole covers on roads
attributes.background: Having ridden motorcycles for a number or years, I have had many encounters with slippery manhole covers on roads, especially while cornering.  The change in surface grip leads to the wheels of the vehicle slipping, potentially causing serious consequences.
attributes.additional_details: There are two practical solutions; either replace the manhole covers with a non-metallic material or coating existing covers with a higher grip material.

attributes.action: Ban vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes from UK roads except between 8pm & 8am
attributes.background: The UK has a problem with its ageing road infrastructure that simply cannot cope with the volume of traffic that uses it on a daily basis. The volume of road traffic needs to be spread out across a 24 hour period, lorries greater than 7.5 tonnes should only be permitted to travel between 8pm and 8am
attributes.additional_details: The average daily commute has just increased to 2 hours and the general public is being forced to spend wholly unacceptable amounts of time in cars for what are often small journeys. Forcing drivers off the road through increased taxes or toll roads is not the answer. The answer is obvious but the government won't take the action required to tackle the problem. Road traffic needs to be spread out over the 24 hour period and allow vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes to only travel between 8pm - 8am

attributes.action: Increase funding for local authorities for Adult Social Care in England
attributes.background: The elderly should have the right to be entitled to remain in their own homes receiving a high standard of care with dignity and respect, until palliative care if required. This should include continuity of care & time to cover all tasks required for the individual with trained care assistants.
attributes.additional_details: I am a registered care manager for a leading care provider who offers the highest standards of care with highly trained and qualified staff. Every week we have customers with specialist needs I.E. dementia, who do not have the time allowed by our local authority due to financial restrictions, or choosing a low standard of care agency who are non compliant due to funding.  This has to stop. This should not be a financial lottery.

attributes.action: A U.K. Sovereign Wealth Fund for the long term finance of Old Age  Pensions.
attributes.background: Norway's Sovereign Wealth fund is the worlds largest, with over $700bn in assets - this equates to about £130,000 for each Norwegian citizen. Singapore also provides another example that the UK could emulate. Primary function of said fund is to finance Pensions for an increasingly aging population.
attributes.additional_details: North Sea Oil reserves are dwindling but still generate sizeable revenue for the UK Government.  This should be directly invested via a National Wealth Fund with the long term view of funding all pensions. A generous slice of all fuel duty receipt's should also be invested in said fund! As we explore Fracking, NOW is  the time to plan ahead for how revenues will be used! Looking at countries like Norway, Singapore and Qatar, A Sovereign Wealth Fund is long overdue for a country as rich as the UK.

attributes.action: Change the law and policy on the use of fireworks in the UK.
attributes.background: Following a recent petition calling for a ban and the official response, to further obtain public opinion on the misuse of fireworks. Government to fund research into the impact on human and animal health and well being to be the primary aim of the research.

attributes.action: Referendum on replacing the House of Lords with a fully elected upper house
attributes.background: The current House of Lords does not reflect the UK population and is currently non elected, this means they has the power to block legislation that could be beneficial for the UK, without actually being elected by any British citizens. Hold a referendum to see if Britons want an elected upper house
attributes.additional_details: The UK is one of the only countries that includes non-elected religious leaders in its Upper House, the only other modern day country that has this is Iran.

attributes.action: Give self-build eco-homes by local families automatic planning permission.
attributes.background: We live in a village and have outgrown our home. We bought a corner of a field close to the village centre to build an affordable Eco-home. This year 278 homes have been approved for building on fields within 2 miles of our site by commercial builders. Ours was refused. It's a double standard.
attributes.additional_details: Local Planning Authorities are supposed to be supporting self-builds, eco-homes, affordable homes and local people. Our LPA refused our application even though no measurable harm was established. High-impact commercial developments with big numbers of homes are favoured. This is wrong and is holding back the solution to the housing supply shortfall.

attributes.action: Create a new licencing law for people transporting horses in trailers
attributes.background: Many people have accidents caused by inexperienced drivers traveling with horse box's (trailers) every day, Usually because these people dont have the experience or training to tow such a heavy loads, People trained to drive B+E vehicles (car & trailer) are trained with empty loads not live animals.
attributes.additional_details:
After careful research I have found that for than 25% of road traffic collisions are caused by people towing horse trailers with horses in them. 
83% of the 25% are motorway collisions causeing full shut downs on the M4 28 times this year alone. 
I believe that new licensing laws are needed for these people that wish to transport their horses around. Especially using the motorway to lower the risk of further accidents and also the trauma this must cause the animals.

attributes.action: Make students learn how to manage money and finance in secondary schools
attributes.background: Students need to learn how to manage their bills and buy food on set budgets. This can greatly improve the standards of young people so that they can go into the world and know what to do with their wage and their savings, instead of wasting money.

attributes.action: Reinstate George Osborne's plan to set up a 2nd hand annuity market
attributes.background: People have been waiting nearly two years to be able to sell their poor monthly payments for cash lump sums where they can make a difference to their lives.   For example, I've sat with no working boiler as I can't afford one without my annuity funds in one payment.

attributes.action: make abortion illegal in the uk unless raped or health risks to mum or baby
attributes.background: make abortion illegal in the united kingdom unless pregnant by rape or there is health risks to the mum and/or baby

attributes.action: Special funding to Councils for social housing for adults with disabilities
attributes.background: Many local authorities have social housing problems... but more so for adults with physical disabilities and/or learning disabilities (who may require shared living). Where housing associations have stepped in to provide properties they charge rents far beyond what is affordable on housing benefit.
attributes.additional_details: Many social housing properties are in disadvantaged areas with high crime, making them unsafe for many adults with learning disabilities, or properties are ill suited for the person's physical disabilities... this results in many people having to continue living wth parents long into adulthood... with complex care needs that place unsustainable pressure on the family relationship increasing the risk of crisis or carer breakdown.

attributes.action: Reduce the drink drive limit in England and Wales to the same level as Scotland
attributes.background: In 2014 an estimated 240 people were killed in Great Britain in accidents where at least one driver was over the legal limit. Drinking and driving increases the risk of a crash and the likelihood that death or serious injury will occur. Reducing the limit will save lives and make our roads safer.
attributes.additional_details: In December 2014 the Scottish Executive introduced The Road Traffic Act 1988 (Prescribed Limit) (Scotland) Regulations 2014 which reduced the legal alcohol limit for drivers to 50 milligrams of alcohol in every 100 millilitres of blood. The limit in England and Wales is 80 milligrams of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood. Bringing the limit in England and Wales in line with the limit in Scotland would be very beneficial as it would reduce accidents, preventing serious injury and death.

attributes.action: Do not impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners
attributes.background: Pensioners have paid Taxes all their working lives now in their latter years with low state Pensions cannot afford to pay an unfair cut in Housing Benefit which is another form of Poll Tax.
attributes.additional_details: The Tory Government is soon to impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners by cutting Housing Benefit to OAPS that have extra bedrooms they say people don't use. Some couples need to sleep alone because of different ailments they have so need the extra bedroom, there is not enough Social Housing to rehouse everybody its Social Blackmail which is not Fair on people who have paid Taxes all their working lives and are about to be hit with an unfair Tax in their Twilight Years when they don't need the worry of it all

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to sort out the funding for Bisphosphonates for breast cancer.
attributes.background: Thousands of women are potentially missing out on taking these inexpensive drugs because of the lack of national guidance on who should fund them. It is not clear whether the hospital trust, the local clinical commissioning group (CCG) or NHS England central funding should be paying for them.

attributes.action: Bring back a discounted fee for regular users of the dartford crossing! DART-TAG
attributes.background: The discounted price of £1.67 is not good enough! As an everyday user I now pay roughly £1219.10 a year in crossings, living 10 mins away in erith! Whereas a few roads away in dartford people have the option to pay a £20 yearly fee! This is appalling - there's needs to be support for everyday users.
attributes.additional_details:
The previous dat tag gave the option of discounted prices, not only for local residents but commuters and regular users.

There is no support for those crossing everyday, they are instead paying out Thousands a year, when those locally have the option of a £20 annual fee.

The payments should have been scrapped once the cost of building was settled.

The Dartford Crossing is raking in £3MILLION per week in fines alone as people can not afford this upkeep on top of their cost of living!

attributes.action: Hold a parliamentary debate on the re-introduction of selective State Education
attributes.background: The Government has announced the return of selection in Secondary Education in England without any manifesto commitment or mandate to do so and 40 years after it was abolished as socially divisive and intrinsically unfair to the economically less advantaged.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister argues that the re-introduction of grammar schools will enhance social mobility. However the evidence on the ground in those few areas where selective education remains entrenched is that though it may do so for the lucky few, many more are left behind. Selection favours affluent families who pay for the extra coaching to pass the selection tests and obstructs access for the poorest.

attributes.action: Investigate the standard of care provided by local CFS ME services in the uk.
attributes.background: Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) / myalgic encephalomyelitis (ME), is a debilitating disease that causes many symptoms including severe fatigue. The quality of care appears to be perticually poor in the uk, especially in rural counties, with some services acting outside of nice guidelines.
attributes.additional_details: My personal experience with my local CFS service has been extremely poor, I was 16 when diagnosed and until I was 18 I was seen 3 times be a children's OT. All that my local CFS service offers is an initial information session (the information was mostly wrong), an initial assessment and a 6 week managing life styles group, this is completely contradictory to the NICE guideline. And they do not offer CBT or GET, 2 of the 3 treatments recommended by NICE. This is not the only service like this!

attributes.action: Permanently move Parliament to a more UK population central location.
attributes.background: The seat of power in the UK has for too long resided in a place inaccessible to most of the country. This has resulted in generations of regional underinvestment and the revenue creation capacity of our country massively skewed to financial services in the City, Greater London and the South East
attributes.additional_details: With a new parliament location a more commutable distance, we can also do away with the cost of many second homes for MPs. The £40+Billion cost of HS2 can be reallocated to pay for a new Parliament building (The final cost of Holyrood was put at £414M) and the renewal of the rail infrastructure to support it. After hundreds of years of revenue flowing from the rest of the UK to the South East, it’s about time it started seeding sustainable growth elsewhere.

attributes.action: Enable Police and Telephone services to trace and prosecute cold callers.
attributes.background: Cold calling is supposed to be illegal, TPS is not a deterrent, so the Police, trading Standards and Telephone service providers should be compelled to cooperate to trace, arrest, and prosecute offenders. A help line should be created for reporting offending numbers.
attributes.additional_details: In this digital world, it should be possible to trace who purchased any number. Citizens can bar withheld numbers to prevent some calls, but there is a problem with normal numbers. These must be held on record by service providers. They must be traceable to a specific location.

attributes.action: Scrap the 7 day week NHS proposals or fund them by the amount the BMA requires.
attributes.background: The "7 day week" proposals would stretch the already stretched resources and people of the NHS well past breaking point, and do Not provide the funding and staff required. The petition to have Mr Hunt removed was brushed aside, can we at least agree his policies need removing?
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is in the proposals themselves and the medical practitioner's need to strike over such an unreasonable contract. No further evidence of inadequate provision is required, the burden of proof lies with those trying to push through the contract.
The BMA are the organisation representing the NHS and it's staff.

attributes.action: Provide statistical report of areas / numbers of culled badgers hosting TB.
attributes.background: The Government failed to test culled badgers to measure the percentage hosting tuberculosis & the most affected areas.  This data is key. UK Government ignored advice of Wildlife Experts by continuing the Badger cull. Other wildlife such as Deer host TB, so the badger cull policy is flawed.
attributes.additional_details: Despite all efforts by wildlife experts to stop the badger cull the Government continues with a badly devised scheme to reduce TB.  The most important data was never obtained. Recording the number of affected culled badgers and the areas where TB was most prevalent is surely crucial for developing a strategy to reduce Bovine TB.  A statistical report will show where number of TB hosts are more severe.  Joined up interventions such as vaccinations and bio-security on farms are needed.

attributes.action: Stop doctors striking and withdrawing emergency care
attributes.background: We ask that the government make it illegal for people who work within the medical profession to withdraw from work and strike for more than 24 hours consecutively.   We also request that anyone doing so be struck off for intentionally causing distress and refusing to treat patients

attributes.action: Introduce banking skills to the secondary curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that it is important that the use of banking services be a mandatory part of the secondary school curriculum as it would appear, from anecdotal reports and observation that many teenagers simply do not understand how to use basic banking services.

attributes.action: Except for MP salary. 100% tax on all other incomes for UK politicians.
attributes.background: Put 100% tax on all external to post income for all UK politicians including offshore investments and holdings. Prevent income and/or wealth transfers for a year prior to position. Ban a time offset for potential missed outside earnings. Ban employment post role in associated industry for 5 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Except for MP salary. Put 100% tax on all income for all UK politicians including offshore investments and holdings. 

To discourage people from becoming MPs for financial gain.

To encourage future MPs to consider their country the primary reason for taking a political post.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to exclude Legal Expenses cover against Financial Institutions
attributes.background: Family legal expenses policies commonly sold by insurance companies as an add on for about £30 specifically exclude taking any legal action against any insurance company or bank for any insurance contract, savings, pension or investment policy. This should be outlawed as an unfair contract condition
attributes.additional_details: The insurance industry has created a self protection society to the consumer's detriment. The Government has heavily criticised the FCA and the Ombudsman they created and often reach a decisions different to the law. The consumer is at their mercy as without legal expenses cover they can't afford to take action against arrogant, big boy bully insurance providers who just tell the consumer to go away. These policies are consequently worthless in this regard one of the biggest industries in the UK

attributes.action: Criminalise the act of impersonating serving military personnel or veterans
attributes.background:
It is getting common recently for civilians to impersonate military service men/women by claiming they are serving or are veterans.

This causes great distress to many veterans and families and is a blatant disregard.

The Stolen Valor Act 2005 has to a great degree mitigated this in the USA.

attributes.action: Legalise the age of buying and smoking e-juice to 14 with parental consent
attributes.background: Vaping and smoking e-juices do not harm kids! I'm 14 years old and I stopped smoking and moved onto e-juice. This is much less harmful then cigarettes and maybe more kids might stop smoking if the legal age was dropped.

attributes.action: Represent Wales in the Union Jack incorporating Y Ddraig Goch (The Welsh Dragon)
attributes.background:
When the Union Jack was introduced in 1606 its design did and still does today represent the four nations which make up the United Kingdom. 

However, it is only made up of three of the constituent countries' flags and we believe, in the spirit of the unity it represents - that should change.
attributes.additional_details:
Agnieszka, S. (2013) The Union Flag and Flags of the United Kingdom. Section Parliament and Constitution Centre, UK.

Cleans, G. (2007) Union Jack should include Welsh Flag, says MP. The Daily Telegraph, UK. 
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/1570613/Union-Jack-should-include-Welsh-flag-says-MP.html

Contributors: Jacob William Billingsley, James Stacey Mayes, Patrick John Alderson, Ruari Iain Macneil

attributes.action: make naloxone available to all opiate / opioid users in the uk.
attributes.background: I myself have almost lost my life to opiate overdoses and I have lost friends to opiate overdoses. lets do our best to stop this. This drug has absolutely no effect on people without opiates / opioids in their system.
attributes.additional_details: Naloxone is a medication used to counter the effects of opioid overdose Specifically, naloxone is used in opioid overdoses to counteract life-threatening depression of the central nervous system and respiratory system, allowing an overdose victim to breathe normally. Naloxone only works if a person has opioids in their system; the medication has no effect if opioids are absent. Naloxone has no potential for abuse.  It is a temporary drug that wears off in 20-90 minutes. (harmreduction.org)

attributes.action: I want a ban on Guns Knives Machetes Swords and other dangerous items.
attributes.background: Guns Knives Machetes Swords are sold openly at Car Boots Sales. We are in a climate where an attack on civilians could happen at any time and in any area. Legislation should be put in place to prevent this practice from continuing.

attributes.action: Stop South Africans voting in UK when Brits can't vote in SA.
attributes.background:
A Brit living in South Africa with permanent residency is prevented from voting in South African elections. However, South Africans can move to the UK and after meeting the residency requirements can vote in all UK elections.
This is grossly unjust and needs to be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Qualifying Commonwealth citizens can vote in all UK elections once they've been resident for the requisite period but in some Commonwealth countries like South Africa there is no reciprocal agreement. This is blatantly unfair and unjust and must be stopped.

Who can vote in a South African election?
http://www.elections.org.za/content/For-Voters/FAQ--Voter-registration/

Who can vote in a UK election?
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/faq/voting-and-registration/who-is-eligible-to-vote-at-a-uk-general-election

Qualifying Commonwealth citizens: http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/__data/assets/electoral_commission_pdf_file/0009/79515/List-of-eligible-countries.pdf

attributes.action: Overhaul the UK 'honours' system so winners are decided by public vote
attributes.background: The recent 'resignation honours' from David Cameron highlights the massively undemocratic way in which honours are handed out - essentially to his friends and those of his wife. The system of 'honours' should be reviewed and overhauled so it operates in a fully democratic way, with a public vote.

attributes.action: Levy £1.00 tax on non recyclable coffee cups and give proceeds to NHS.
attributes.background: Britain throws away 2 500 000 000 coffee cups a year which cannot be recycled. The technology exists to make them recyclable. This tax will make it an economic necessity for the BIG coffee companies to act.
attributes.additional_details: Reference BBC1 program presented by Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall "War on waste" 21:00 July 28 2016.

attributes.action: Call for a Ban on the Industrial Manufacture of Honey in the UK
attributes.background:
Current methods cause massive unnecessary slaughter of Bees. Bees are vital to our survival and to maintaining our delicate eco systems
Unnatural methods used by industrial beekeepers, such as A.I, antibiotics, clipping a Queen Bee's wings are wholly unacceptable
All to satisfy corporate greed
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/GreenWorldTVUK/videos/1623198151304386/?__mref=message
